body:
Respectfully, you are arguing for a smaller change which few have asked
for, over a larger, harder, change which a market of users of Go have been
asking for for many years now. I don't see this as a competition to make
_a_ change to the language, therefore justifying the smaller, easier
change. As I stated above this proposal is a net negative for those who
teach and learn Go. A cost all must pay yet most stand very little chance
of reaping any benefit from unless they are lucky enough to join Google and
are assigned a massive refactoring task.

On Wed, 20 Jul 2016, 00:14 Ian Lance Taylor <notifications@github.com>
wrote:
